result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus T Escobedo

records.addlTxt:
The original document was titled: Letter dated October 11, 2022 - re: Counseling
The original history event date is: 10-17-2022

10:07 AM Defendant Jesus T Escobedo in court.  Attorney Justin L. Singleton in court for Jesus T Escobedo.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests time for treatment.
Defense to file the documents regarding treatment with  the Court.
Hearing scheduled for January 27, 2023 at 09:30 am.

11:16 AM Defendant Jesus T Escobedo in court.  Attorney Justin L. Singleton in court for Jesus T Escobedo.  Attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for State of Wisconsin. City of Waukesha Police Department Officer Alyssa Lincoln sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Tempelis. Exhibit #1 marked but the State is not asking for the Court to receive it into evidence. Exhibit #1 returned to the State. Cross examination by Attorney Singleton. State rests. State moves for bind over without argument. Attorney Singleton objects to bind over with argument. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Waive reading of Information. Attorney Singleton stands mute as to a plea. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 032351,
Payable Number: 472571,
Receipt Number: 22R 035095,
Amount: $20.00

Preliminary hearing on August 19, 2022 at 10:15 am.
CORRECTED - PRELIM IS IN PERSON
Preliminary hearing on August 19, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to have no contact with individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key or their residence or school.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

09:00 AM Defendant Jesus T Escobedo in court with attorney Thomas James, as a friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 10:15 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on 06/28/2022
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
